Title: Omens Oracles & Prophecies
Description: Oracles & Prophecies provides an overview of divination systems, ranging from ancient Chinese bone burning to modern astrology. It explores pre-scientific" prediction systems and theoretical frameworks connecting them."
Instructor's Bio: Robert Wheeler Willson Professor of Applied Astronomy at Harvard University
Additional Information: Institution: HarvardX; Subject: Social Sciences; Level: Introductory; Language: English; Length: 1 week, 3-5 hours per week; Part of PredictionX XSeries Program

Title: Lost Without Longitude
Description: Explore the tools and techniques of navigation, with a particular focus on the importance (and difficulty) of measuring longitude.
Instructor's Bio: Robert Wheeler Willson Professor of Applied Astronomy at Harvard University
Additional Information: Institution: HarvardX; Subject: History; Level: Introductory; Language: English; Length: 1 week, 2-5 hours per week; Part of PredictionX XSeries Program

Title: John Snow and the Cholera Epidemic of 1854
Description: An in-depth look at the 1854 London cholera epidemic in Soho and its importance for the field of epidemiology.
Instructor's Bio: Robert Wheeler Willson Professor of Applied Astronomy at Harvard University
Additional Information: Institution: HarvardX; Subject: History; Level: Introductory; Language: English; Length: 1 week, self-paced; Part of PredictionX XSeries Program

Title: Shakespeare and His World
Description: Explore the life, works, and times of William Shakespeare, from his birthplace in Stratford-upon-Avon to the London playhouses.
Instructor's Bio: John Cogan University Professor of the Humanities at Harvard University
Additional Information: Institution: HarvardX; Subject: Literature; Level: Introductory; Language: English; Length: 4 weeks, 3-5 hours per week; Part of Shakespeare XSeries Program

Title: Rhetoric: The Art of Persuasive Writing and Public Speaking
Description: Gain critical communication skills in writing and public speaking with this introduction to American political rhetoric.
Instructor's Bio: Gurney Professor of English and Professor of Comparative Literature at Harvard University
Additional Information: Institution: HarvardX; Subject: Humanities; Level: Introductory; Language: English; Length: 8 weeks, 2-3 hours per week; Part of Professional Certificate in Leadership and Communication

Title: Building your Screenplay
Description: Learn to strengthen your skills as a screenwriter, while diversifying your knowledge and understanding of the demands of global film and TV production.
Instructor's Bio: Course Director at Institute of Continuing Education University of Cambridge
Additional Information: Institution: University of Cambridge; Subject: Communication; Level: Intermediate; Language: English; Length: 4 weeks, 8-10 hours per week; Part of MicroMasters® Program in Writing for Performance and the Entertainment Industries

Title: Ancient Masterpieces of World Literature
Description: Examine how cultures of the ancient world defined themselves through literature and how their vision of literature contributes to our understanding of civilization, culture, and literature today.
Instructor's Bio: Martin Puchner: Byron and Anita Wien Professor of Drama and of English and Comparative Literature at Harvard University. David Damrosch: Ernest Bernbaum Professor of Literature at Harvard University.
Additional Information: Institution: HarvardX; Subject: Literature; Level: Introductory; Language: English; Length: 6 weeks, 3-6 hours per week; Associated skills: Collections, Writing

Title: First Nights - Monteverdi's L'Orfeo and the Birth of Opera
Description: Learn about Claudio Monteverdi's L'Orfeo, one of the first operas ever written.
Instructor's Bio: Morton B. Knafel Professor of Music at Harvard University
Additional Information: Institution: HarvardX; Subject: Humanities; Level: Introductory; Language: English; Length: 3 weeks, 3-5 hours per week; Part of XSeries in Classical Works

Title: Dante Alighieri: Science and poetry in The Divine Comedy
Description: Explore Dante's Divine Comedy through a discussion of the sources and references of the poetry and modern science
Instructor's Bio: Professor at Università di Napoli Federico II
Additional Information: Institution: FedericaX; Subject: Literature; Level: Introductory; Language: English; Length: 4 weeks, 8-10 hours per week

Title: Ancient Egyptian Art and Archaeology
Description: Explore the archaeology, history, art, and hieroglyphs surrounding the famous Egyptian Pyramids at Giza. Learn about Old Kingdom pharaohs and elites, tombs, temples, the Sphinx, and how new technology is unlocking their secrets.
Instructor's Bio: Barbara Bell Professor of Egyptology at Harvard University
Additional Information: Institution: HarvardX; Subject: Art & Culture; Level: Introductory; Language: English; Length: 8 weeks, 2-4 hours per week; Associated skills: Archaeology, 3D Modeling

Title: Graphic Design Specialization
Description: This series of courses, offered by the California Institute of the Arts (CalArts), teaches the fundamentals of graphic design, including typography, image-making, and history.
Instructor's Bio: Faculty member at CalArts, specializing in typography.
Additional Information: Institution: CalArts; Level: Beginner to Intermediate

Title: Graphic Design Bootcamp
Description: Hands-on tutorials for creating design projects like logos, business cards, and social media graphics.
Additional Information: Institution: Udemy; Level: Beginner to Intermediate

Title: Principles of Graphic Design
Description: Core principles of graphic design, including layout, composition, and color theory, in this self-paced course from edX.
Instructor's Bio: Renowned designer and creator of the Google logo.

Title: Typography Fundamentals
Description: Learn history, principles, and applications of typography in this AIGA course.
Instructor's Bio: Professional designers and typographers from AIGA.

Title: Graphic Design for Beginners
Description: Practical tutorials for beginners to create compelling designs on Domestika.
Instructor's Bio: Founder of Draplin Design Co., known for bold designs.

Title: MoMA Graphic Design Online
Description: Explore graphic design’s history, key movements, and notable works in this interactive online course from MoMA.
Instructor's Bio: Experts in modern art and design education.
Additional Information: Institution: MoMA; Level: Beginner to Intermediate

Title: Perspective Drawing
Description: This long course on perspective drawing teaches you classical techniques to draw accurate perspective. Instruction videos + assignments + online community.

Title: Figure Drawing Fundamentals
Description: Learn to draw the figure with video lessons, demonstrations, assignments, and the goofy, charming humor of Proko.

Title: Anatomy for Drawing
Description: Proko take you through every bone and every muscle. He teaches you how it works, not just what it's called. Videos, assignments, and demos.

Title: How to Create a Color Script
Description: Nathan shows you the art of designing and developing a color script for film.
Instructor's Bio: Nathan Fowkes is a veteran entertainment industry artist with credits on 12 animated feature films including DreamWorks Animation’s The Prince of Egypt, Spirit, several projects within the Shrek Universe, How to Train Your Dragon, Blue Sky’s Rio 2, Ferdinand and Wonder Park from Paramount Animation and development art for Disney’s Raya and the Last Dragon.

Title: Designing with Light and Color
Description: Nathan teaches his best techniques for designing with light and color for concept art, painting from imagination, and traditional art.
Instructor's Bio: Nathan Fowkes is a veteran entertainment industry artist with credits on 12 animated feature films including DreamWorks Animation’s The Prince of Egypt, Spirit, several projects within the Shrek Universe, How to Train Your Dragon, Blue Sky’s Rio 2, Ferdinand and Wonder Park from Paramount Animation and development art for Disney’s Raya and the Last Dragon.

Title: Environmental Design
Description: Learning Environmental Design for films, games, comics, and TV—as well as techniques for traditional fine art.
Instructor's Bio: Nathan Fowkes is a veteran entertainment industry artist with credits on 12 animated feature films including DreamWorks Animation’s The Prince of Egypt, Spirit, several projects within the Shrek Universe, How to Train Your Dragon, Blue Sky’s Rio 2, Ferdinand and Wonder Park from Paramount Animation and development art for Disney’s Raya and the Last Dragon.

Title: Visual Storytelling
Description: Learn techniques called "The Invisibles" for generating images that tell a story from one of the most loved pros in Film.
Instructor's Bio: Iain McCaig divides his energies between a lifelong love of storytelling, and a passionate belief that everyone in the world can learn to draw. McCaig is best known for his cover art for Jethro Tull's 'Broadsword and the Beast' and for his Star Wars designs for Queen Amidala and Darth Maul. His film work includes 'Interview With the Vampire', 'Dracula', 'Terminator 2', 'Hook', 'Peter Pan', 'Charlotte's Web', 'Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire', 'The Avengers', 'Guardians of the Galaxy', and 'Star Wars Episode VII'. He is also a Chesley nominated illustrator, having illustrated books ranging from 'Fighting Fantasy' to J.R.R.Tolkien's 'The Hobbit'.

Title: Graphic Design Basics
Description: Graphic Design legend, Ellen Lupton, teaches the basics of Graphic Design
Instructor's Bio:
Ellen Lupton is a 
writer, curator, educator, and designer. Lupton is the Betty Cooke and William O. Steinmetz Design Chair at MICA (Maryland Institute College of Art) in Baltimore. I've authored and co-authored many books about design practice, including Thinking with Type, Graphic Design Thinking, Graphic Design: The New Basics, and Design Is Storytelling.

Title: Your Job is Story
Description: 3-minute video lecture from Stanford's GSB on Story.
Instructor's Bio: James Buckhouse is a writer, designer, and artist.
Additional Information: 3 minute video on story from Stanford

Title: Build an AI-Powered Game
Description: Interactive course on using AI to create games.
Additional Information: interactive course on game design and AI

Title: The Unanswered Question: Six Talks at Harvard
Description: Mr. Bernstein explores what music means below the surface: the symbols and metaphors which exist in every musical piece. Includes a great demonstration of the overtone series.
Additional Information: Mr. Bernstein considers a universal language central to all artistic creation. Using certain linguistic analogies, he explores the ways in which this language developed and can be understood as an aesthetic surface. Mr. Bernstein also explores what music means below the surface: the symbols and metaphors which exist in every musical piece, of whatever sort.

Title: How to Create a Color Story
Description: How to create a color story for film, TV, brand, or products

Title: UI and UX for AI
Description: An ever-updating collection of new approaches to UI/UX in the era of AI.

Title: How to Write a First Sentence
Description: A great first sentence opens the door, sets the stakes, triggers your curiosity, and gives you a reason to care. This post offers writers three main techniques (with examples) to set you down the path of inventing a marvelous first sentence.

Title: How to Give a Toast
Description: You’ve been asked to give a toast. Do it well and everyone loves you. Mess it up and you’ll lose the trust and support of everyone in the room. Here’s a structure you can put to work immediately for your next important toast.

Title: How to Design for Near-Instant Wow
Description: Use design to defeat the ticking clock of Customer-Product Fit. When designing a product… ask yourself this terrifying question: How long does it take to get to WOW? Here's a guide to get there.

Title: How to Write a Joke
Description: At the risk of ruining all jokes for you forever, here’s the structure of a joke, why it works, and how to write one.

Title: Augmented Imagination
Description: Article that discusses AI as Augmented Imagination instead of Artificial Intelligence.

Title: How to Gain Constructive Confidence
Description: How to use design principles to improve your self-confidence, recognize your shortcomings, and perpetually improve.

Title: How to Design Emotional Products
Description: The famous Jobs-To-Be-Done framework helps PMs and Designers figure out what functionality to design for a product, but not how to design the actual experience. For that, it helps to pair it with Emotions-To-Be-Felt.

Title: Product Design Friction Audit
Description: A friction audit is a list of every moment of confusion, frustration, concern or delay in your product experience and a plan for how to improve the total experience.

Title: Words Matter: Writer's Checklist
Description: To transform the mysterious art of content into a repeatable and measurable process, we created this checklist of characteristics common to exceptional stories.

Title: The Arc Product-Market Fit Framework
Description: This framework outlines three distinct archetypes of PMF which help you understand your product’s place in the market and determine how your company operates.

Title: Human Experience Design
Description: Meditation on Pixels and the Human Condition

Title: How to Design a Story Map
Description: A story map is a new type of design document that shows the big idea of your product experience at a glance.

Title: Ice-Cream for Editors: How Start with Your Conclusion
Description: Guide for a new writing and editing technique that encourages initial free form exploration and then strategic reordering and editing.

Title: Design Thinking is BS
Description: Provocative lecture about the design process

Title: Game Design
Description: Collaboration, prototyping, playtesting. The Sims creator Will Wright breaks down his process for designing games that unleash player creativity. Requires subscription

Title: Creative Writing
Description: Learn how the author of The Handmaid’s Tale crafts vivid prose and hooks readers with her timeless approach to storytelling. Requires subscription.

Title: Chat with Your Data
Description: Use LangChain to chat with your data

Title: Robert McKee Story Webinars
Description: Hollywood story legend, Robert McKee, offers online webinars on the art of story.

Title: Master Responsive Layouts in Figma
Description: You'll learn how to make layouts that are easy to use and work well on any device. We'll cover key concepts and tools to help you master responsive design in Figma.

Title: Prototype and Code iOS apps in Figma and SwiftUI
Description: You’ll learn to create a visually appealing and functional wallet interface using DesignCode and Apple UI Kits.

Title: Master No-Code Web Design with Framer
Description: You'll learn to create modern, user-friendly interfaces in Framer

Title: Cinematic Lighting
Description: How to achieve cinematic lighting  with the 3 main light sources — the key light, the fill light, and the backlight. Video

Title: Cinematic Composition
Description: Video: seven techniques for cinematic composition.

Title: AI-osaurus
Description: I wrote a tool to help writers walk through the dark garden of word-choice. Describe your concept and then click on the different categories of investigation to get different approaches to seed your imagination.

Title: 24-Hour Story, Art and Design Hotline. +1 (650) 675-5734
Description: I created a 24-Hour Story, Art, and Design Hotline using all of my past posts, videos, and podcasts. The "intelligence archive" of my AI-second self is built and hosted my Delphi. Call anytime.

Title: Find a Job at the Sequoia-backed Company
Description: Direct link to jobs at Sequoia-backed (or Sequoia-adjacent) companies.

Title: Dance Weekly
Description: Find yourself in Paris and want to go to the ballet or see some contemporary dance? This guide shows what's on each week. AI dance agents scour the web and return the latest ballet events for you.

Title: AI Art Agent
Description: Every morning, our curious and intrepid A.I. Art Agent takes a walk through Tokyo, Paris, and beyond to explore the current exhibits, take a few photos, and write up a helpful guide.  Eventually, after just the right amount of lingering over a coffee or crepe or a baguette with both brie and jam, it makes its way back to the Story Dept. to update and adjust everything and then post it to the world.

Title: Does my site work on mobile?
Description: Test your site at different browser sizes.

Title: AI Software Design Studio
Description: AI Software Design Studio

Title: Harvard CS50
Description: Harvard University's introduction to the intellectual enterprises of computer science and the art of programming
Instructor's Bio: Gordon McKay Professor of the Practice of Computer Science

Title: Søren Kierkegaard - Subjectivity, Irony and the Crisis of Modernity
Description: In this course we will explore how Kierkegaard deals with the problems associated with relativism, the lack of meaning and the undermining of religious faith that are typical of modern life.
Instructor's Bio: Former Associate Professor, University of Copenhagen
Additional Information: Jon Stewart is Associate Professor at the Søren Kierkegaard Research Centre at the University of Copenhagen.

Title: Cinematography and Lighting Tutorials
Description: Practical, hands-on demos of shooting the Indy Way. Emphasis on cinematic lighting.
